en.presente_par: A Théâtre français de Toronto Original New Play
en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto presents Lara Arabian’s new play...
en.description:
The Khourrys, a family of Lebanese-Canadian origin, have recently moved to a Toronto suburb. Their beliefs are soon tested when 13-year-old Zara begins to hear a mysterious voice speaking to her.

Where do our convictions come from? Are they inherited from our families? Influenced by our environment? Do they come from our education? Or from our relationship with religion?

**Lara Arabian**’s new play questions the place our socio-cultural heritage should take in our lives as personal experiences inevitably shape our own convictions. The play is presented in Limoges, France, at the Festival des Zébrures, from September 22 and 23, 2023. This is the first time a TfT creation is presented across the Atlantic.\
\
Exclusive Preview set for September 15 at 7:30 p.m. at the Berkeley Street Theatre.

en.presente_par: A Théâtre français de Toronto New original Play
en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto presents Sébastien Bertrand's Les Filles du roi.
en.description:
France, 1673. Louis XIV himself acknowledges it. New France is struggling to develop. The math is unforgiving: there are too many men; not enough women. A recruitment campaign to find young girls to marry is quickly put together.

Armande, Martine, Dorimène, Mariane, Angélique and Agnès (mythical characters from Molière’s comedies) are all designated ‘King’s Daughters’ and board a ship bound for these new horizons. Their mission: birth a new generation of citizens. But, in reality, different reasons motivate these young women and some are hiding dark secrets.

Written by **Sébastien Bertrand** (***Les Liaisons dangereuses: correspondances inédites***) *Les Filles du roi* stages an eventful voyage to New France through the point of views of six female characters.\
\
**ALL PERFORMANCES ARE ENGLISH SURTITLED.** YOU ALSO HAVE THE OPTION TO TRY ON OUR AUGMENTED REALITY GLASSES FOR A MORE IMMERSIVE SURTITLING EXPERIENCE. TOGGLE BETWEEN ENGLISH OR FRENCH. YOUR PREFERENCE! OF COURSE, IT'S FREE OF CHARGE.

en.titre: Les Zinspiré.e.s : Onze calme et on continue
en.presente_par: A Théâtre français de Toronto Original New Play
en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto presents Les Zinspiré.e.s : Onze calme et on continue directed by Constant Bernard.
en.description:
Original. Unique. Eagerly awaited by some. TfT presents the eleventh edition of Les Zinspiré.e.s. This series of shows continues to generate admiration and enthusiasm from audiences and critics alike.

Les Zinspiré.e.s is a writing contest in Southern Ontario schools where more than 200 teenagers submit their stories; writings that highlight their preoccupations and the current subjects that inspire them. In the end, five stories are chosen and brought to the stage by a team of professional artists.

Humorous. Tragic. Burlesque. The writing styles intertwine and complement each other thanks, once again this year, to an ingenious staging by **Constant Bernard**.

SYNOPSIS:

**SYNDROME DE L'IMPOSTEUR (IMPOSTER SYNDROME)** by Shannon Villeneuve (É.s Père-René-de-Galinée, Cambridge) coached by Lara Arabian

In a dystopian future, it's illegal to be multiracial. Shan finds herself forced to choose between her
two races.

**LES PRINCESSES ET L'ÉPÉE (PRINCESSES AND THE SWORD)** by Alexandra Pokas (Don Mills Collegiate Institute, Toronto) coached by Djennie Laguerre

Ready to fight for her starving kingdom, Ophelia must face a mountain, a dragon and another princess as sassy as herself to save her prince.

**ZARATHUSTRA** by Philippe Paré (É.s.c. Renaissance, Aurora), coached by François Macdonald

Freely inspired by Nietzsche's character, this great sage will have to come down from
the top of his mountain and face up to the ridiculous idiocies that plague
mankind in 2023.

**LA FILLE N'EST PAS MORTE (THE GIRL’S NOT DEAD)** by Leyao Xiao (Havergal College, Toronto) coached by François Macdonald

Juliette is struggling to come to terms with the death of her best friend Stella. She decides to wake her from her eternal sleep with black magic, but soon realizes that the zombie version of her friend is not what she had imagined.

**JE SUIS (I AM)\*** by Sephora N'Kosi (É.s.c. Saint-Frère-André, Toronto) coached by Merlin Simard

A slam poem. An ode to Generation Z, questioning and reclaiming the identity of today's teenagers.

**\*WARNING: This poem includes the use of the N-word.**\
\
**ALL PERFORMANCES ARE ENGLISH SURTITLED.** YOU ALSO HAVE THE OPTION TO TRY ON OUR AUGMENTED REALITY GLASSES FOR A MORE IMMERSIVE SURTITLING EXPERIENCE. TOGGLE BETWEEN ENGLISH OR FRENCH. YOUR PREFERENCE! OF COURSE, IT'S FREE OF CHARGE.

en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto in association with Crow’s Theatre presents L’Amour telle une cathédrale ensevelie by Nous Théâtre.
en.description:
The author and director **Guy Régis Jr**. continues his x-ray examination of dislocated Haitian families: those who seek a better future beyond the waves and prejudices. Those who respond to the call of the sea, to this thirst for a new life.

An opera/theatre/concert hybrid, *L’Amour telle une cathédrale ensevelie* tells the tragic tale of an ‘Intrepid Son’ who leaves Haiti to reunite with his mother in Quebec, that cold and unknown land.

With the Haitian classical guitarist **Amos Coulanges**, Guy Régis Jr composes an opera, a poetic song, in Creole and French. He sings the grief of these inescapable crossings, these maritime epics between Haiti and Canada, between Senegal and France. The choir members of **Les Voix du Coeur Vocal Ensemble** will showcase their talent and passion in this performance that combines theatre, music, and emotions.

**ALL PERFORMANCES ARE ENGLISH SURTITLED.** YOU ALSO HAVE THE OPTION TO TRY ON OUR AUGMENTED REALITY GLASSES FOR A MORE IMMERSIVE SURTITLING EXPERIENCE. TOGGLE BETWEEN ENGLISH OR FRENCH. YOUR PREFERENCE! OF COURSE, IT'S FREE OF CHARGE.

en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto presents Mononk Jules by Productions Illusion Fabuleuse.
en.description:
Inspired by the life of his great-uncle **Jules Sioui**, one of the greatest Indigenous heroes of the 20th century, Jocelyn Sioui paints a portrait of a fascinating man and, through him, of an indigenous history obscured by white memory.

Through the use of miniatures and projections, surrounded by boxes of archives, Jocelyn Sioui magically transports us from one historical event to the next. Funny, touching and energetic, **Mononk Jules** is a captivating story delivered with authenticity by Jocelyn Sioui.\
\

en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto presents Quichotte, an Ombres Folles original adaptation of The Ingenious Gentleman Don Quixote of La Mancha.
en.description:
In a world as harsh as it is fragile, made of paper, **Quixote** and **Sancho** are seeking new adventures. The imagination of the frail knight comes into play: colourful, epic and with shadow puppetry! But Quixote’s beliefs are too strong... Everywhere, people call him crazy.

Follow a clownish duo, in search of glory. A play that asks: should we cling to a zany reality, or let ourselves be carried away by foolish dreams?

Ombres Folles, the contemporary shadow and object theatre company, presents an ingenious show freely inspired by the novel *The Ingenious Gentleman Don Quixote of La Mancha* by Miguel de Cervantes.

en.presente_par: A Théâtre français de Toronto and Vox Théâtre Original New Play
en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto and Vox Théâtre present Le Roi poubelle.
en.description:
On an island made up entirely of trash, Elise, a young shipwrecked documentary filmmaker, meets the enigmatic Roi poubelle (The Trash King), the sole inhabitant and self-proclaimed ‘ruler’ of this drifting mass of plastic.

Through nostalgic melodies and musical delirium, **Le Roi poubelle** explores loneliness, mourning, hope and the feeling of having to face alone the harmful effects of overconsumption.

The music is composed and played on instruments made entirely from waste and recycled materials. In a playful way, the piece invites the audience to rethink its relationship with its material consumption.

en.description:
Two friends, Octave and Léandre, have each married for love young women of unknown births and social classes. And this without the consent of their fathers! Scapin, a cunning and generous valet, returns to the stage to help youth and true love triumph.

In a frenzied rhythm, a troupe of five actors, musicians and singers stage one of Molière’s funniest plays. A classic comedy revisited in music in the spirit of La comedia dell’arte.

“***It is a bright example of the young, collective-minded ensembles that have sprung up in France in recent years***.”\

en.sommaire: Théâtre Catapulte presents Nombre by Alpha Charlie Kilo, a show for secondary students.
en.description:
Unexpected and surprising, Nombre is a participatory theatrical work designed for the classroom. At the start of the experience, the students are given simple instructions, which at first glance seem trite. But thanks to an ingenious system of numbers, they are soon plunged into the heart of a show in which they are both the inspiration and the main players. Guided from a distance by ‘invisible stage hands’, a thrilling story emerges – their own!

Adapted from the original production by the Alpha Charlie Kilo collective (Quebec), Nombre reminds us of the exquisite singularity of human exchange and the importance that a simple encounter can have in our lives. This production focuses on the themes of inter-connectivity and encounters, offering young people a unique human and interactive experience.

en.presente_par: Théâtre français de Toronto presents
en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto is proud and pleased to present Les Liaisons dangereuses: correspondances inédites, a web series written by Sébastien Bertrand and directed by Karine Ricard, available for streaming directly from TfT's website starting June 15, 2022.
en.description:
PRICE FOR THE COMPLETE SERIES: $15 FOR ONE WEEK OF ACCESS.

**THE FIRST THREE EPISODES ARE FREE.** To access the complete series, you will have to make a $15 payment when reaching Part 4. you will then have one week to watch the last five episodes.

**SYNOPSIS**

“***Born to avenge my sex and to master yours***,” La Marquise of Merteuil

Paris, 1782. Pierre Choderlos de Laclos publishes *Les Liaisons dangereuses* (*Dangerous Liaisons*), a collection of letters which brings to light the decadent pleasures, unscrupulous alliances, and perverse rivalries between former lovers and expert manipulators the Marquise de Merteuil and the Vicomte de Valmont. One hundred seventy-five authentic letters revealing the correspondence of two libertines, those of their victims, and their abused witnesses.

Despite the shockwaves that this tale of seduction, libertinism, and betrayal provokes in France at the time of its publication, it becomes an immediate success. (According to rumours, even French queen Marie-Antoinette is said to have ordered her copy and concealed its cover to avoid controversy).

But when a series of unpublished letters resurface, Laclos discovers a scandalous, new tale filled with intrigue, unusual power plays, unknown plots, and surprising pacts.

***Les Liaisons dangereuses : Correspondances inédites*** is a web series that takes a new look at the novel *Les Liaisons dangereuses* by Laclos.

en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto presents Manman la mer by Théâtre Catapulte. Created by Djennie Laguerre, the play focuses on women and Caribbean spirituality.
en.description: TO APPEASE HER MOTHER, MARJOLAINE HIDES HER GIFT OF CLAIRVOYANCE TO HER FAMILY… but twenty-six years later, she is struck by a mysterious illness that modern medicine is unable to treat. With no other options, Marjolaine travels to Haiti to seek the healing powers of her grandmother, Manman La Mer … Performed by Djennie Laguerre with great sensibility, Manman La Mer puts Caribbean women and spirituality in the spotlight and explores with humour and authenticity the sometimes complicated relationships between mothers and daughters.

lieu.nom: Berkeley Street Theatre: Marilyn and Charles Baillie Theatre

en.sommaire: TfT and Canadian Stage present an original work by Orange Noyée and le Théâtre français du CNA in collaboration with Théâtre du Nouvel-Ontario, le Théâtre français de Toronto, le Théâtre Duceppe, le Théâtre du Trident, le Théâtre populaire d’Acadie, le théâtre l’Escaouette, le Théâtre la Seizième and le Cercle Molière.
en.description:
IN UN (ONE), MANI SOLEYMANLOU TRIES TO PINPOINT WHAT EXACTLY DEFINES HIM AS AN IRANIAN LIVING IN CANADA. In DEUX (Two), he is joined on stage by Manu (Emmanuel Schwartz), his kindred spirit. Together they search for what he might have missed in his initial quest for identity. A quest that culminates with TROIS (Three).

Co-presented with Canadian Stage, UN, DEUX, TROIS. is simply breathtaking in scale and scope. The production involves no less than 40 performers from across Canada. All of them acting as co-creators. This epic trilogy reflects the cultural and political heritage of North America, the diversity of its communities, and the richness of its territories and many climates. These co-creators will all share their lived experiences, ideas, aspirations, and frustrations, to question what forms, divides, and unites us.

This production is a quest for collective intimacy, a kaleidoscope of committed and engaging voices.

Presented in French with English surtitles.

“*Let's not beat around the bush, the end result is stunning*." Christian Saint-Pierre - Le Devoir

"*It's an important play in a country like ours which argues it’s reaching out to refugees. And it's a show that reminds us how essential theatre is when it carries a strong message and dares to really connect with the world.*" Alexandre Vigneault - La Presse

TROIS was created in Montreal in 2014 by Orange Noyée in coproduction with the Centre du Théâtre d'Aujourd'hui and the Festival TransAmériques.

en.presente_par: A Théâtre français de Toronto Production
en.sommaire: TfT presents the 10th anniversary edition of the series Les Zinspiré.e.s
en.description:
DON’T MISS THE 10TH ANNIVERSARY EDITION OF LES ZINSPIRÉ.E.S. THE DORA AWARD-WINNING THEATRICAL SERIES IS BACK, ON STAGE, IN PERSON, THIS WINTER!

What is *Les Zinspiré.e.s* you ask? It is a youth-development initiative intended on introducing the art of playwriting and storytelling to teenagers. It’s a creative forum without censorship or taboos. Over the last 10 years, this initiative has brilliantly brought to life 50 thought-provoking, sometimes heart-wrenching and often hilarious stories written by teens themselves.

What is *Les Zinspiré.e.s* ? It’s a generational mic-drop!

SYNOPSES

**DÉJÀ VU by Alexa Laliberté**\
Isaac's alarm goes off. He turns it off. It's September 7. The first day of Grade 12. He's looking forward to finishing high school and finally being free! It's an ordinary day... In French class, he receives his first project: to write an urban tale. Running out of ideas, he decides to write a story similar to Groundhog Day where his main character - also named Isaac - relives the same day over and over again. On his way home, he is hit by a car and suddenly dies. Isaac's alarm rings. He turns it off. September 7... again?! Like the character played by Bill Murray, Isaac will have to find a way out of this time loop without a groundhog.

**GRANDMA'S LAMB by Clara Stoenescu**\
September 8, 1958. A quiet Sunday evening in a small, *quiet* Victorian house with an unobstructed view of the *quiet* harbours of Brighton, England. A fairly affluent family finishes their dinner; an old lamb leg found in the basement freezer carefully prepared by Agatha, the grandmother. The next morning, Stuart, her grandson, discovers Agatha's dead body and immediately calls his parents, Louisa and Alden. When Stuart points out that his grandmother's smile is missing a tooth, Louisa tells us that this is a murder and that the murderer must be in the house! Drawing on films such as Clue and Eugene Ionesco's theatre of the absurd, this murder mystery is peppered with humour and larger-than-life characters. Can they find the culprit?

**STAY OR GO by Clara Koeller Smirnios**\
Young, fragile, in love: Marie finds herself caught between a difficult family life, a new older boyfriend who is manipulative and a new friend who is becoming more and more important in her life - and in her heart. Will she have the courage to leave an abusive relationship?

**(TRIGGER WARNING**: This play tackles themes of physical and emotional abuse)

**HERE COMES MARGARET CLAUS by Safa Usman**\
When Santa runs off with Cinnamon (his favourite stripper from The North Pole), Mrs Claus - Margaret Claus - must deliver all the presents to the children of the world herself. Lacking a certain dexterity, she falls down the chimney and comes face to face with Lea, an astute preteen with a thousand and one questions. Having been unmasked, Margaret confirms her identity and is quick to share her opinions on men - all dirty dogs who only think with their little peckers! A cross between a feminist life lesson and a story of hope and unconditional love for a child’s missing father.

**THE MURDER OF INNOCENCE by Anthony Atalian**\
In the autumn of 2020, Azerbaijan launches an attack on Armenia in what will, mutually, become known as the "40-day war." Hovsep, a young Armenian pianist is torn. Should he defend his country and his family honour by enlisting in the army and heading to the front to join his father ? Faithful to his country and his father, he leaves for Hadrut with his best friend Davit at his side. How will he manage to take another's life? Does God forgive such a sin?

**TAMIKA by Briana Phillips**\
Intelligent, stubborn, direct: Tamika suffers the worst menstrual cycle of her life! What has she done to deserve such 'punishment'? Eve (from the Bible!) arrives and turns Tamika's room into a court of law to show her how 'Judge God' could pass such a sentence on women. After this glimpse behind the scenes, will Tamika be able to reconnect with her Bible-loving mother?

**CALL ME IF YOU GET LOST by Alexia Dumouchel**\
It has been 385 days since Natasha has been waiting for Tyler the Creator's concert. Now she is running late because her mother has the wrong address and her BFFs seem to be more interested in boys and their followers on Instagram. Several increasingly outlandish adventures test Natasha's positivism and culminate with a fellow spectator vomiting on her; an event that triggers an explosion of emotions and opinions she had previously suppressed. Her evening ruined, can she at least save her friendship with Tamika and Isabelle?

en.presente_par: An original new play by Théâtre français de Toronto, La Troupe du Jour et Fittonia Films
en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto, La Troupe du Jour et Fittonia Films presents FLUSH by Marie-Claire Marcotte.
en.description:
IT’S SNOWING. THE WIND IS TIRELESS. CORINNE KNOCKS ON THE DOOR OF A SMALL HOUSE LOST IN THE PRAIRIES. She needs to rent a room for her goldfish and herself. Is it possible to share such a tight space with a little girl who’s obsessed with grasshoppers, a wise fool who won’t speak and a grandmother who can no longer endure music? In this somber comedy, a touching quartet investigates the deep meaning of the word “family.”

*Flush*, written and directed by local multi-disciplinary artist Marie-Claire Marcotte and co-produced with La Troupe du Jour and Fittonia Films, had its world premiere in Saskatoon in February 2022 to great applause and full houses.

en.presente_par: A Vincent Leblanc-Beaudoin and Théâtre français de Toronto coproduction, in collaboration with DopoLavoro Teatrale

lieu.nom: In Situ. Saint-Frère-André Catholic Secondary School.

en.sommaire: TfT presents a Vincent Leblanc-Beaudoin and Théâtre français de Toronto coproduction, in collaboration with DopoLavoro Teatrale
en.description:
A MAN IN UNIFORM APPEARS AT THE END OF THE CORRIDOR. Follow him and discover the astonishing nightly journey of a janitor as he goes from classroom to classroom and through the hidden corners of a school. Leap into an immersive, wordless experience where reality turns into a dream. Through its examination of what it means to be part of today’s working class, *Le Concierge* (The Caretaker) paints a touching portrait of a lonely character whose work is too often taken for granted.

“*Daniele Bartolini and his company DopoLavoro Teatrale have been pushing audience-specific work into new territory.*” — Carly Maga, THE TORONTO STAR

PLEASE NOTE:

* The number of spectators is limited to 15 per performances.
* Audience members are required to walk up and down stairways during the show.
* Audiences members are required to wear a uniform (provided).
* Masks are an integral part of your experience and one will be provided as a part of your costume.
* Some scenes take place in low light and in tight spaces.
* No box-office on site. If you wish to purchase tickets on the day of the performance, please buy them online or by phone;
* Please note that March 8 and 9 are previews and the premiere is on March 10.

en.presente_par: A Théâtre français de Toronto Production
en.sommaire: TfT presents Crawlspace by Karen Hines translated by Mishka Lavigne.
en.description:
AUTHOR KAREN HINES EXPLORES THE DARK SIDE OF REAL ESTATE IN CRAWLSPACE, a Kafkaesque comedy, translated from English by Mishka Lavigne, which takes a deplorable look at Toronto's cruel and wacky real estate industry. CRAWLSPACE is a study of the human condition. It’s also a play that highlights the importance of twig orbs that decorate the tables and nooks of houses on sale.

Directed by Miriam Cusson, this award-winning play makes its French-language debut.

en.presente_par: A Créations In Vivo Production
en.sommaire: Le TfT presents Vaches, the Musical, the fraco-ontarian musical comedy by Créations In Vivo
en.description:
VACHES, THE MUSICAL, IS THE NEW PRODUCTION OF CRÉATIONS IN VIVO.

Do you dream of seeing Casselman, the ice storm and a cow named Caramel in the same movie? So do we. But until we get the budget, here’s the musical. Very freely inspired by a true story, *VACHES, the musical*, tells how Jean, a farmer, attempts to save hundreds of cows from certain death despite the obstacles: his urban daughter, the money-hungry mayor, the soldiers who show up and the ice storm that is freezing the hearts of the inhabitants.

Both funny and touching, *VACHES, the musical*, speaks (and sings!) with humour and sincerity about living together and Franco-Ontarians "standing tall" in the face of adversity.

Recipient of four awards following a showcase at the 39th Contact Ontarois, *VACHES* is the very first Franco-Ontarian musical.

**ENGLISH SURTITLES AVAILABLE AS WELL AS MULTILINGUAL SMARTGLASSES**

[**SPECIAL FUNDRAISING EVENT ON MAY 11, 6:30 p.m**.](https://theatrefrancais.com/en/nouvelles/soiree-benefice-2023/): A Fundraising Gala with a live performance of VACHES, THE MUSICAL, cocktail hour during the intermission, followed by a country-style reception with live auctions at the Enoch Turner Schoolhouse.

Fundraising Gala Event Price: $150 with a $100 tax receipt.\
Special rate for those under 30: $100 with a $50 tax receipt.

en.sommaire: Celebrate our 55th artistic season with a country-themed evening on Thursday, May 11th starting at 6:30 pm at the Berkeley Theatre and, following the show, at the historic Enoch Turner SchoolHouse
en.description:
**Come celebrate our 55th artistic season with a country-themed evening on Thursday, May 11th starting at 6:30 pm at the Berkeley Street Theatre and, following the show, at the historic Enoch Turner SchoolHouse.** It's a great opportunity to celebrate this new season together and to raise funds to support our youth projects and upcoming productions.

This event will shine the spotlight on an original (and hilarious) Franco-Ontarian creation: ***Vaches, The Musical*** which includes a cocktail during the intermission, immediately followed by an auction and Gala featuring local products. *Vaches* is a funny and touching musical that speaks, with humour and earnestness, about "togetherness" and Franco-Ontarians standing tall in the face of adversity.

The Gala will be held in the form of a buffet. Auctions will include packages and carefully curated items starting at various price points. Our Master of Ceremonies Pierre Simpson, TfT Director Karine Ricard and the entire TfT team look forward to welcoming you to this fundraising event!

**INFORMATION**

Date: Thursday 11 May at 6.30 pm

Evening Schedule:

* 6:30 p.m: performance of the show ***Vaches, The Musical*** at the Berkely Street Theatre (26 Berkeley Street) including a cocktail during the intermission
* 8:15 p.m: Gala and auction at Enoch Turner SchoolHouse (106 Trinity Street)
* Drinks, and alcoholic drinks, are included with your ticket

Fundraising Gala Event Price: $150 with a $100 tax receipt.\
Special rate for those under 30: $100 with a $50 tax receipt.\
Attend your first Gala!

If you would like to purchase an unassigned ticket so that someone who cannot afford it can attend this fundraiser, please contact Natalie at 416-534-7303 ext 22

If you would like to be a sponsor or in-kind partner for this event, please contact [Maxime Kottmann](mailto:mkottmann@theatrefrancais.com) by email or phone at at 416-534-7303 ext. 29

en.presente_par: Native Earth Performing arts and le Théâtre français de Toronto, in association with Luminato Festival Toronto present
en.sommaire: Native Earth Performing arts and le Théâtre français de Toronto, in association with Luminato Festival Toronto present a play that combines documentary and radio testimonies to immerse audiences in the daily lives of five young women from Nunavik.
en.description:
**“Choosing silence to hear something beautiful”**: that’s the meaning of Aalaapi in Inuktitut. This play combines documentary and radio testimonies in French, English and Inuktitut to immerse audiences in the daily lives of five young women from Nunavik who share their lives between the North and the South. These intimate portraits, depicted with speech, sound and silences, reveal the richness of their history and the power of their future.

**ENGLISH SURTITLES AVAILABLE.**

**NOTICE TO PARENTS:** On Saturday, June 10, for the 1:00 p.m. performance, TfT will be offering free on-site childcare for your children ages 4 to 12! Thanks to the support of **Balancing Act**, the **Summerhill Club** will be happy to entertain your children during the show.

en.presente_par: A Théâtre de l'Oeil Production
en.sommaire: TfT presents Perruche produced by Théâtre de l'Oeil and written by Virginie Beauregard-Dyotte
en.description:
NOAH, A CHILD WITH A PASSION FOR THE TROPICS AND ITS WILDLIFE, LIVES WITH HIS CHEERFUL ACCOMPLICE, A PARAKEET NAMED COEUR-COQUIN, AND HIS MOTHER AND FATHER…WHO ARGUE A LOT. One Halloween morning, Coeur-Coquin escapes. Noah is shocked by the sudden departure of his friend and finds himself alone, in a world seemingly unfazed by his personal loss. Sad, angry, Noah can only think of one thing: to find Coeur-Coquin and put some colour back into his life. Suddenly, his room turns into a peculiar jungle; one he’ll need to tame if he wants to locate his lost friend. In this mystical journey, our hero meets strange, disturbing and inspiring characters who accompany him on his quest. A fabulous adventure reminding us that painful ordeals can sometimes lead to transformative change.

French Only. No Surtitles.

en.titre: Toqaq Mecimi Puwiht / Delphine rêve toujours
en.presente_par: A Ondinnok & Théâtre de la Vieille 17 Production
en.sommaire: TfT presents Toqaq Mecimi Puwiht / Delphine rêve toujours from March 1 to 4, 2023: a creation by Wolastoqey playwright Dave Jenniss
en.description:
WITHOUT THE BEATING OF THE DRUM, THE WORDS WILL NOT COME. Delphine is a young Wolastoqiyik (Maliseet) girl, full of dreams and determination. Ever since her father lost the drum of his late muhsums, Delphine has been determined to find it at all costs. One autumn day, as the wind picks up, Delphine is transported into the world of the forest spirits. There she meets the mischievous porcupine, the opera-singing owl, and the Kiwahq, a monster with a heart of ice! Will she overcome her obstacles and find the drum?

In his play *Toqaq Mecimi Puwiht / Delphine rêve toujours*, Wolastoqiyik author Dave Jenniss tackles the themes of transmission and identity as he reappropriates the language of his ancestors and makes it resonate. This bilingual show, in French and Wolastoqey is performed by indigenous and non-indigenous actors.

en.titre: Mesdames et messieurs, garçons et filles
en.presente_par: A Vox Théâtre Production co-presented with Alliance française de Toronto
en.sommaire: TfT presents Mesdames et messieurs, garçons et filles by Vox Théâtre
en.description: THE STORY FOLLOWS 9-YEAR-OLD FINN WHO HAS COME OUT AS A BOY. After attending a fascinating circus performance, the young boy decides to cut his hair short and change his name. Finn’s family works to understand and adjust to his gender identity. Dad accepts the change right away, but Mom struggles. We see Fin’s family grapple with their child’s transition with the best of intentions and, ultimately, begin to accept and embrace Fin for who he is.

en.presente_par: A Théâtre français de Toronto Production
en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto presents a show touring within Southwestern Ontario schools
en.description:
**SHOW TOURING SCHOOLS ALL YEAR LONG**

TfT is making a show available to Ontario schools which can be performed in a classroom : "A traveler finds refuge in a log cabin during a blizzard. While waiting for the storm to pass, he shares stories with the cabin’s inhabitants, sharing tales and legends of French America”.

"*My 4th and 5th graders absolutely loved* Les Contes du voyageur\_! They were on the edge of their seats for the entire performance. I particularly enjoyed the interactive nature of the play, with the actor making use of the whole classroom for his stage and interacting with the students. The show was engaging, funny and educational, and it fitted in perfectly with our curriculum. I look forward to inviting you back again soon\_" - Ben Ross, Grade 4/5 French Immersion Teacher, Morse Street Jr. Public School"

"*I really enjoyed the show. It was very entertaining because I really enjoyed the stories and they made me laugh a lot. The comedian was very expressive and funny. I really liked the story with the pirates*"- Kian.

**SCHOOLS: The price is $350 (+ traveling expenses) for two performances over one day**. Performances, which include interactions with students, take place in the classroom (not in a gym).

Interested? You may be eligible for financial assistance in the form of small grants from [PassepART]().
en.distribution:

en.presente_par: The WeeFestival of Arts & Culture for Early Years
en.sommaire: Once again, Théâtre français de Toronto is proud to be part of the WeeFestival as an official partner of the festival's francophone line-up.
en.description:
The **WeeFestival of Arts & Culture for Early Years** returns for its 7th edition with live performances in Toronto, the Greater Toronto Area, and Ontario from **May 16 to June 11**!

Once again, **Théâtre français de Toronto** is proud to be part of the WeeFestival as an official partner of the festival's francophone line-up.

This spring, WeeFestival will present over fifty performances for toddlers, preschoolers and school-aged children, promising beautiful, stimulating and joyful theatrical experiences for the youngest members of our community (and their adult guests!)

The dynamic and diverse 2023 line-up promises unforgettable first-time theatre experiences, with performances dedicated to French-speaking audiences - whether in French or without spoken words.

**Calendar**

(String)**

l’écume** (Echoing Crest)

en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto presents Solstice d’hiver co-produced with the Groupe de la Veillée. A witty and disturbing play by Roland Schimmelpfennig, directed by Joël Beddows.
en.description:
Christmas Eve and nothing is ready. Bettina and her husband Albert aren’t happy: Bettina’s mother is staying for the holidays. Which is awkward. Not least because Bettina’s mother met a man on the train. And now she’s invited him to spend the evening with them... Everything is in place for a comedy of errors, as we know them.

Through this seemingly predictable situation, Roland Schimmelpfennig subtly exposes the workings of new modern day fascism. In Winter Solstice, it sneaks into a well-meaning society, among “good” and cultured people who do not seem equipped to recognize its resurgence.

Director Joël Beddows invites us to this unusual and strangely titillating comedy. He brings to the stage a society obsessed with comfort, success and stability.

en.titre: Le Club des éphémères (The Shadflies Club)
en.presente_par: Théâtre français de Toronto and Théâtre du Nouvel Ontario present
en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto presents Club des éphémères co-produced with Théâtre du Nouvel Ontario and directed by Dillon Orr. A sharp comedy by Alain Doom.
en.description:
WHEN A FILMMAKER PRODUCING A DOCUMENTARY ABOUT SHADFLIES UNEXPECTEDLY APPEARS IN THEIR RETIREMENT HOME, the lives of five elderly women are turned upside down. The passion they feel for these ephemeral insects that emerge each spring from the lake is only equaled by their obsession with the Dionne quintuplets.

Under the spotlight, the unexpected bond uniting these five women also comes to light. Terrible stories they had never thought to reveal resurface as they seize the moment and confess secrets for the first and last time in their lives.

Up and coming Franco-Ontarian director Dillon Orr presents Alain Doom’s most recent play, written during his time as Théâtre français de Toronto’s “playwright in residence”. An incisive feminist comedy evoking the ephemeral nature of our lives with humour and tenderness.

**TRIGGER WARNING**: This play tackles themes of emotional and sexual abuse.

en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto presents Petit bout de bois by the company djaram’arts et le tas de sable - chez panses vertes. A story about the courage of resourceful children who don’t give up on their dreams.
en.description:
PETIT BOUT DE BOIS, A PUPPET SHOW ABOUT THE LIFE OF STREET CHILDREN IN SENEGAL. Exploited by a deceptive school system, the young Souleymane finds himself on the street, forced to beg and to bring what he’s collected back to the Serignes daara, “Koranic masters” who will supposedly educate him.

A story about the courage of resourceful children who do not give up on their dreams despite life’s hardships.

en.presente_par: Crow’s Theatre and Théâtre français de Toronto present a Le collectif Nous sommes ici, le Théâtre Catapulte and La Bordée coproduction
en.sommaire: Théâtre français de Toronto and Crow’s Theatre present Singulières by Nous sommes ici, Théâtre Catapulte and Théâtre la Bordée. In the form of a funny and surprising investigation, Singulières redefines the contemporary single woman.
en.description:
For two years, playwright Maxime Beauregard-Martin and director Alexandre Fecteau, recipient of the Crow’s Theatre RBC Rising Star Emerging Director Prize, conducted multiple interviews with a group of single women in Québéc pursuing happiness that does not include marriage and motherhood.

A funny, lively, and surprising investigation, Singulières redefines the contemporary single woman by exploring feminism and the Catholic conventions with deep roots in Québec culture. Through intertwining interviews, live camera work, and the imaginative use of green-screen technology, Singulières is a series of beautiful stories about women who, in spite of society’s expectations, are leading fulfilling and fascinating lives.

Both documentary theatre-makers and regular collaborators, Maxime Beauregard-Martin is a playwright and performer and Alexandre Fecteau is an award-winning director and playwright as well as Artistic Director of le collectif Nous sommes ici.

en.presente_par: Théâtre français de Toronto and WeeFestival present Shayenne Productions
en.duree: 45 minutes (25 minutes plus 10 minutes pre-show and 10 minutes post-show)
en.sommaire: The WeeFestival in association with Shayenne Productions and the Théâtre français de Toronto presents the show Yassama et la calebasse aux cauris for children aged 3 to 6.
en.description:
*Yassama and the Beaded Calabash* will be presented as part of the [WeeFestival of Arts and Culture in May 2022](https://weefestival.ca/weefestival-2022/). Stay tuned for the official announcement in the new year.

*“Once upon a time in a not so distant past, somewhere in a village in a land far awaythere lived a young girl named Yassama.”*

Yassama and the Beaded Calabash is the story of a young girl who, with the help of the old Baobab tree, saves her village from drought and delivers a powerful lesson about the importance of respecting and honouring Mother Earth. Acclaimed artist Lua Shayenne weaves vibrant dance and music with engaging storytelling in an interactive performance created especially for young children.

*Yassama and the Beaded Calabash was commissioned and developed with the support of the WeeFestival of Arts & Culture and Théâtre Français de Toronto.*
en.equipe:

Music: **Cécé Haba**
Dramaturgy and education consultation: **Lynda Hill**
Director: **Karine Ricard**
Costumes: **Rachel Forbes**
